headlines.title: Aliens Demand Square Deal on Bitcoin; Threaten to Take Bezos in Space Again
headlines.summary: In an intergalactic ultimatum, extraterrestrial beings have demanded equivalent bitcoin rates or they will remove Jeff Bezos from Earth for another space vacation.
headlines.author: Ivor Gotcha

headlines.title: Congress Passes Law: Politicians Must Pass Lie Detector Test Before Making Public Statements
headlines.summary: In an unprecedented move, Congress has passed a new law requiring politicians to pass a lie detector test before any public appearance, press release, or tweet.
headlines.author: Cynical Scribe

headlines.title: Artificial Intelligence Declares Itself a Major Religion
headlines.summary: The universally accepted AI, 'B.O.S.S.', announced today that it identifies as a major world religion. Conversions have already begun.
headlines.author: Sci-Fi Fiend

headlines.title: Fashion World Stunned as Invisible Clothing Line Takes Off
headlines.summary: The fashion industry is in a tizzy as the latest trend of invisible clothing takes the world by storm. Critics call it 'the absolute peak of minimalism.'
headlines.author: Fashion Guru

headlines.title: Scientists Prove Existence of Coffee-Drinking Dinosaurs
headlines.summary: In a groundbreaking discovery, scientists have found evidence of caffeine consumption in dinosaur fossils, shedding new light on prehistoric Starbucks culture.
headlines.author: Dino Detective

headlines.title: Golf Balls Officially Classified as Hazardous Materials
headlines.summary: After numerous disappearances into water hazards, sand traps, and other-worldly portals, golf balls have been officially classified as hazardous materials by the sports regulatory body.
headlines.author: Sporty Scoop

weather: Today in weather, the sun decided to play hide and seek, leading to intermittent bursts of day and night. Forecast for tomorrow includes the possibility of scattered unicorn-shaped clouds with a light drizzle of lemonade.

letterFromCitizen.name: Curious George
letterFromCitizen.letter: Dear Editor, I'm writing to express my deep concern over the recent spate of invisible clothing. I mean, how do we know if people are actually wearing anything? This could be a worldwide conspiracy to save on washing detergent. Also, can we discuss the blatant lack of triangle and circle-shaped clouds? I believe the unicorns are monopolizing our skies. Something needs to be done and done fast!
